message: I like Zenburn, but it's not the only one I use
It's a little more pastel than I'd like but it's not bad

Now that I am using iTerm2 and 256 colors, I like desert256. Looked at a whole ton of 256-capable schemes and so far that's the only one that hits enough of the languages I use (eg includes Markdown etc) and isn't ugly :)
I really like the molokai theme. Especially in MacVim.

Yeah... molokai with envy R code font is HAWT - http://damieng.com/blog/2008/05/26/envy-code-r-preview-7-coding-font-released
It's ok off the terminal, but it's better on gvim on MacVim
I've been using wombat for a while now and love it (for those who like dark background themes) http://dengmao.wordpress.com/2007/01/22/vim-color-scheme-wombat/
+1 for wombat, I'm using wombat256mod http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2465
jellybeans
http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2555
I like desert256 and jellybeans, but unfortunately my gVim doesn't look that shiny, like in the theme screenshots http://nanotech.nanotechcorp.net/downloads/jellybeans-ruby.png
@0chris perhaps the "shiny" factor is related to the font you are using? My favs are Bitstream vera sans mono, and inconsolata - maybe should be a whole new topic...
I'm using a slightly modified IR_Black, which I had been using in TextMate: http://blog.toddwerth.com/entries/show/8
ir black, both in MacVim and in iTerm2 https://github.com/iain/osx_settings
@ptone Could be the font, but I think it's MacVim in the screenshot (I'm using gVim on linux)
+1 for wombat
got it first for visual studio when I used to code .net for money
Holy crap. I hadn't really played with colorschemes, and just installed both wombat and wombat256mod. They're both *very* nice, but I'm sold on the latter.
I'll google it, but wombat256mod doesn't seem to have support for Python, whereas wombat does.
Ah, nevermind. GNU screen apparently doesn't support 256 colors by default.
Really like jellybeans, just wish it had wider language support
/me learns to set "term screen-256color' to enable 256 colors in GNU screen.
Rolling my colorful one. For the simple reason that I have the colorscheme customized for all plugins I use. https://github.com/mitsuhiko/dotfiles/blob/master/vim/colors/fruity.vim
im using ir_black
molokai for a dark one, and summerfruit when something brighter is needed
Definitely wombat
@ptone this is exactly the theme I am using too, only with Terminus as font both on the terminal and g/MacVim

Currently really liking jellybeans for gVim/MacVim and terminal use including Putty. I'm also a fan of ir_black and inkpot depending on what I'm editing. This could change since I found the this github repo the other day - https://github.com/flazz/vim-colorschemes.
currently using lucius
I was using molokai, but have recently switched to zenburn. I like both of them, but zenburn is much better in the terminal.
+1 wombat256
I've been using a modified version of vilight, which is a modified version of twilight.
https://github.com/shelbybark/dotfiles/blob/master/vim/colors/vilight.vim
I would be nice if everyone could also post a screenshot. Just paste the URL here to profit from the cool inlining feature of convore
Wombat http://dengmao.files.wordpress.com/2007/01/wombat-py.png?w=480
slate is my new favorite
For instance: vilight http://robrobbins.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/09/vilight_1-300x225.png
Been using railscasts for almost a year now but I'm starting to get bored of it. Will give it a go and create my own colorscheme (based on railscasts) when there's time.
vividchalk http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=1891

~  cat .vimrc | grep colorscheme
colorscheme tango2
Railscasts: http://zork.net/~nick/screenshots/colorcomparison.png
screenshot of my modified vilight: http://media.stevenmcrawford.com/shelbybark/img/screenshots/vilight_mod.png
i've been trying out lots of schemes, but I settled down with Lucius :) http://min.us/mvbwO8b
anyone else having rendering artifacts in gvim on linux? small dots that aren't correctly cleared away, seems to be related to italic strings.
I see those artifacts too. A ctrl-L fixes them, but I wonder if there is a way to eliminate them from occurring at all.
Desert is my favorite color scheme
+1 for fruity by @mitsuhiko  only colorscheme that is cool and readable at the sametime.IMHO
koehler, always.
id been using the one from vimcasts, but i just installed janus, so we'll see how that goes.
like our souls.
lots of dark themes it seems
underwater http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2977 so far =]
+1 zenburn
+1 for wombat and wombat256mod
does anyone else get tripped up by :colder every time they go to change colorschemes?
@hynek it only occurs on some fonts, for me at least... try with bitstream vera sans mono
@sharat87 indeed...that sucks big time, I fell in love with Inconsolata. :(((
+1 desert
Plus one for Lucius http://goo.gl/MRqaW
Wow, I just found out jellybeans through this thread. Was using desert256. Groovy! :) Monaco is my favorite font, even after trying inconsolota.

summerfruit, ironman mod and fruidle for light themes, twilight2 mod, ir_black, railscasts, and candycode for dark themes;  generally use a couple at a time for different tasks on the same project (ex. front-end stuff light, backend-stuff dark)
wombat256
xoria256 - http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2140

I use freya, it's good for poorly lit areas like my apartment since it's dark. And they used colors sparingly, and in matching hues/saturations so the code isn't over colored and the important parts stick out nicely.
Zenburn with the little known option let g:zenburn_high_Contrast=1
Looks better on modern monitors
@locks underwater looks very nice.
Ever since I got an LCD I had to go light background
Dark was good on CRT's but that time has passed
HERALD
Couldn't find 'HERALD', so here's a screenshot of 'herald' http://www.h3rald.com/images/herald.vim/herald_vim_example.png
inkpot
I like clouds_midnight, herald and atom
After years of dark colorschemes, I'm using github http://cl.ly/51ut
I use vwilight https://gist.github.com/796172/
ir_black
molokai here: http://files.droplr.com/files/13009542/nXHw.parser_test.rb%20(~_programming_sources_mustache_test)%20-%20VIM.jpg
i like ir_black  http://blog.toddwerth.com/entries/show/8
ir_black screenshot: http://blog.toddwerth.com/entry_files/8/vim_ir_black_sc1.png
I use a slightly modified version of mustang http://hcalves.deviantart.com/art/Mustang-Vim-Colorscheme-98974484
Risto, which I originally based off of TaxtMates's VibrantInk http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=3493 Screenshot: http://www.codeography.com/images/risto-vim-html.jpg
+1 w0mbat

Slightly customised version of jelly beans:
http://img705.imageshack.us/img705/7108/jellybeans.png
synic and sometimes elflord or torte
twilight
Molokai, sometimes railscasts
I really like molokai, but it doesn't support python quite good.
I use my ir_black; in Vim, Terminal, and more and more: iTerm2
